item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases 5 TCG Character Cards for Version 4.7
item.description:
Highlights

  • Five new Character Cards are coming to Genius Invokation TCG in Genshin Impact's Version 4.7 update, according to a recent leak.
  • Version 4.7 will introduce popular characters like Furina and Wriothesley to the in-game Genshin Impact TCG.
  • While details were not given about the new characters' abilities in Genius Invokation TCG, they are expected to play similar roles to their Genshin Impact versions.

A new leak from Genshin Impact is teasing five new Character Cards coming to Genius Invokation TCG with the Version 4.7 update, including popular characters like Furina and Wriothesley. The in-game trading card game for the HoYoverse RPG has served as one of its most successful alternative game modes, allowing players to build decks and battle others with their favorite characters. Genshin Impact has regularly updated Genius Invokation TCG with new cards, more challenges, and even entirely new game types. Now, a plethora of characters are coming with the card game's next update.

Character Cards serve as the most important part of a player's deck within Genius Invokation TCG, serving as the backbone of their strategy. When building a deck, players choose three Genshin Impact characters to serve as their main units, with a wide range of more than 80 characters to choose from. Each Character Card also comes with their own unique Talent card players can use to boost up their character during a match, providing unique and powerful buffs to the character's skills. Now, five new characters are joining Genius Invokation TCG's next update.

Related
Genshin Impact TCG: Best Meta Deck
Due to the PvP feature for Genshin Impact Genius Invokation TCG, itâ€™s no surprise that some decks become meta.

Genshin Impact Leaks 5 Genius Invokation TCG Character Cards

A new leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Dim is teasing the five character cards coming to Genius Invokation TCG during Genshin Impact 's Version 4.7. Version 4.7 is set to feature two of Fontaine's most popular five-star characters seeing their introduction to the TCG, with Furina and Wriothesley becoming playable . The update will also include a mix of fan-favorite four-star characters from Liyue and Sumeru, with Xinyan, Kaveh, and Yun Jin all being added to the TCG. No details were given about the characters' Skills or Talents within Genius Invokation TCG.

  • Furina
  • Wriothesley
  • Xinyan
  • Kaveh
  • Yun Jin

While the Genshin Impact leak did not detail any characters' abilities, Genius Invokation TCG characters tend to fit into similar niches to their Genshin Impact counterparts. Furina will likely utilize summons based on her Elemental Skill, dealing passive Hydro damage to an opponent's characters. Wriothesley will likely play a main damage role, while other characters like Xinyan and Yun Jin are expected to play more supportive roles in the TCG. Genius Invokation TCG's newest update will launch with Version 4.7, currently rumored to release on June 5.

The addition of a new set of Character Cards to Genius Invokation TCG comes during a patch expected to feature plenty of new content for Genshin Impact . Version 4.7 will introduce a trio of new characters, including the long-awaited Clorinde, to the game's playable roster, alongside a rumored update to the game's Archon Quest. Endgame content will also reportedly see several updates in Version 4.7, including revamped rewards for the Spiral Abyss . Fans of Genius Invokation TCG should have plenty of new options for building decks with the launch of Genshin Impact 's Version 4.7 update.

item.title: PUBG Bringing Back OG Map
item.description:
Highlights

  • The original Erangel map returns to PUBG in May, complete with classic in-game UI and more vintage features.
  • PUBG Studios plans to reimagine existing worlds to create new in-game experiences, hinting at more throwback maps.
  • Erangel Classic will feature reduced recoil, longer enemy knockdown time, foggy weather, and more for a limited time.

Developer PUBG Studios has revealed that the original Erangel map is returning to PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds in May. The throwback version of the PUBG map includes vintage features like the classic in-game UI and more.

PUBG 's 2024 roadmap hinted at such a possibility when it mentioned that PUBG Studios plans to "reimagine existing worlds" to create new in-game experiences. This is apparently one of the developer's focuses for the year, so it's possible that more PUBG maps could get throwback editions or makeovers like the 7th Anniversary Erangel map released in March. Fortunately for PUBG fans looking for new ways to enjoy their favorite game, there is not a long wait until the next reimagined map releases.

Related
PUBG: Battlegrounds is Right to Take a Page Out of Battlefield's Playbook
A standard Battlefield feature is coming to PUBG, and the battle royale is right to finally embrace the Battlefield franchise's influence.

Erangel Classic will be available to play from May 14 to May 28 on PC and from May 23 to June 6 on console. During these periods, the map's Classic version will replace the current Erangel map in Normal Match. Erangel Classic features an assortment of throwback features like foggy and rainy weather, bench weapons on the starting island, and the original UI's minimap, worldmap, font, and graphics. The map includes some significant gameplay changes as well, such as its weapons having reduced recoil and knocking down enemies taking longer, both of which aim to recreate PUBG 's early days. Other adjustments are the Tommy Gun being available in care packages and clothes and helmets spawning on the ground.

OG Erangel Returning to PUBG In May

PUBG Studios plans to release full patch notes on May 13 that fully detail all the map's changes. After the announcement, many fans called for PUBG 's starting island voice chat to return as well, but PUBG Studios has not mentioned this feature. It seems that the developer may have already revealed all the major changes coming with Erangel Classic, although this is just speculation.

PUBG 's last major update arrived earlier in April and added a significant new feature in destructible terrain. Currently, this mechanic is only available on Rondo, where users can use the new pickaxe or other tools to manipulate the environment, adding another layer of strategy to the battle royale.

As for PUBG 's future, its 2024 roadmap also placed an emphasis on improving the game's anti-cheat system. PUBG Studios revealed it banned over 3 million cheaters during 2023, which was a 33% increase over 2022. Over the next year, the developer plans to detect even more cheaters by implementing machine-learning technology into its anti-cheat. Apparently, this technology is especially effective at detecting some of the most popular types of cheats, like aimbots and ESPs.

item.title: New Vegas Director Has Interesting Take On Fallout TV Series
item.description:
This article has spoilers for the Fallout TV series

Obsidian Entertainment's Josh Sawyer, director of Fallout: New Vegas , commented on a reference to his game made toward the end of the new Fallout Amazon series. Josh Sawyer was formally part of Black Isle Studios as a designer working on the Icewind Dale franchise before he joined up with Obsidian Entertainment in 2005. Most recently, Sawyer directed Pentiment , a 2D historical narrative adventure game which garnered critical praise when it released on Xbox Game Pass in 2022.

Just a few weeks ago, Amazon's long-awaited Fallout TV series hit Prime Video and is considered one of the best video game adaptations ever made . The show has been such a major success, that the two most recent Fallout titles, Fallout 4 and Fallout 76 , have seen players returning in droves. The franchise is seeing tons of new fans as the conversation surrounding the show has continued to permeate the internet. Some corners of the fanbase have expressed concern over a particular shot of the Mojave Wasteland, worrying that the show may have retconned Fallout: New Vegas . Franchise director Todd Howard addressed these worries and assured fans that New Vegas is still canon in the Fallout universe.

Related
Fallout Star Responds to Moldaver Fan Theories Following Season 1 Finale
After Fallout's Season 1 finale, fans wondered: How did Moldaver survive? Actress Sarita Choudhury finally spills the beans in a revealing interview.

In an interview with Rock Paper Shotgun , Josh Sawyer was asked about his feelings regarding New Vegas ' brief presence in the show , and how he'd feel if Bethesda chose to revisit it, or if any future Fallout project were to impact it. Sawyer responded by saying "...whatever happens with it, I don't care...My attitude towards properties that I work on, and even characters I create, is that I don't own any of this stuff. It was never mine. And the thing that I made is what I made."

Obsidian's Josh Sawyer Isn't Concerned About What Happens With Fallout: New Vegas

This may sound strange coming from such an esteemed creative mind in the gaming world, and his stance could cause fans to think there's bad blood between Sawyer and Bethesda. However, Sawyer stated his reasoning for such a mindset, saying "I don't feel like it's healthy for me to be really invested in something I have no control over."

With Fallout in the air, many fans of the franchise are wishing for Xbox and Bethesda to let Obsidian take Fallout for another spin, as Bethesda Game Studios' Fallout 5 isn't expected until about 2030 the earliest. It would be interesting to see whether Josh Sawyer would be up to revisit the Fallout universe, or if he'd choose to continue creating smaller games within Obsidian, such as Pentiment.

I don't feel like it's healthy for me to be really invested in something I have no control over

Just weeks after the Fallout show launched, it's already received the green light for a second season. As for fans of Obsidian, Avowed is slated to come later this year . Fans should expect to learn more about the fantasy RPG, including its release date, at Xbox's June showcase. Beyond that, Obsidian is also working on a sequel to its 2019 sci-fi RPG The Outer Worlds , though it's been several years since any new info has been shared.

item.title: Stellar Blade Update Will Remove 'Unintentional' Reference to Racist Language
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sony will remove an accidental racial slur reference in Stellar Blade through a day-one patch, acknowledging the unintentional mistake.
  • Stellar Blade has received positive early reviews despite a few controversies, and is still set for a successful debut.
  • Sony confirmed that Shift Up did not intend to reference a racial slur in a piece of in-game artwork, addressing concerns with swift action.

Sony announced the day one patch for Stellar Blade will remove an unintentional reference to a racist slur. While initial reviews for Stellar Blade lauded Shift Up's action-adventure game, one particular image taken from a review copy highlighted a likely accidental but problematic graphic in the game.

Active members of the gaming community will likely already recognize Stellar Blade , Shift Up's bombastic third-person action game, which has already garnered attention for its over-the-top action and eye-catching character design. The excitement surrounding the game has reached an all-time high, with Stellar Blade even becoming the most pre-ordered game on the PlayStation Network store following the release of its action-packed gameplay demo. However, as players came closer and closer to the game's release and early reviews for Stellar Blade came pouring in, some online users spread screenshots of what appeared to be an unintended allusion to a problematic term.

1:37
Related
EA Throws Shade at CERO After Stellar Blade Rating
A senior EA official throws shade at Japan's Computer Entertainment Rating Organization following Stellar Blade's age classification.

Sony took notice of players' concerns and announced it would be removing the graphic with an update. As reported by IGN , the Japanese tech giant claimed the company had no intention of denigrating or discriminating against any racial or cultural group, and that the screenshot's problematic reference was unintentional. The infamous screenshot itself was centered on two graphical elements. The first was the texture for a piece of graffiti that simply read, "Hard." When added to the neon sign for the in-game "R Shop," some players were worried the accidental combination might spell trouble for developers.

Sony Announces Fixes in Stellar Blade's Day-One Patch

Sony also clarified that the developers at Shift Up had similarly not intended to reference a racial slur in their artwork. Fortunately for Sony, the mistake itself is easily fixable, and the company revealed it was taking swift action by removing the problematic graphic from Stellar Blade at launch through a day-one patch.

Despite the slight hiccup, Stellar Blade is still on track for a successful debut. Early reviews for Stellar Blade have been overwhelmingly positive, with critics praising the game's intense combat and memorable boss fights. Players can also look forward to the planned addition of several post-launch features for Stellar Blade , which includes a New Game+ mode and free costumes for its main character, Eve.

It's safe to say that the run-up to Stellar Blade 's debut has not been free of controversy. Between critiques of Eve's character design and false rumors claiming Stellar Blade might be censored in several countries, the game has had a bit of a rocky pre-release. Thankfully, it seems most of Shift Up's troubles are at an end, with Stellar Blade ready to take the PlayStation 5 by storm when it finally launches on April 26.

item.title: May 1 is Going to Be a Big Day for Disney Dreamlight Valley
item.description:
Highlights

  • Disney Dreamlight Valley is adding new characters like Daisy Duck and Oswald.
  • There will be enhanced functionality with the free Thrills and Frills update, including in-game selfies and a fishing excursion.
  • Even more content is coming to the game in May.

Disney Dreamlight Valley is set to roll out a ton of new content on May 1. This includes two new characters, as well as the introduction of the Thrills and Frills update and The Spark of Imagination, part of the Disney Dreamlight Valley expansion pass, A Rift In Time, which launched in December.

The expansion content that's already been released through the first wave of A Rift In Time has given players the introduction of new Disney characters like Rapunzel, Gaston, EVE, and Jafar, as well as a bunch of new customization items, critters to interact with, biomes to explore, and board games to play, among other things. But the most noteworthy addition to Dreamlight Valley 's A Rift In Time has been Eternity Isle, an additional area that effectively doubled the size of the game's world, and which will also be getting some upgrades in May.

Related
Why Disney Dreamlight Valley Fans Should Expect More Frozen, Moana Content Soon
Although nothing has been confirmed yet, Frozen and Moana fans may be in for a flood of new Disney Dreamlight Valley content soon.

Dreamlight Valley 's creators announced via Twitter that all of the new content would be coming to all platforms on the same day, May 1, including the introduction of Daisy Duck and Oswald the Lucky Rabbit, a Disney character from 1927 . The free Thrills and Frills update will include enhanced functionality when taking in-game selfies, which includes taking photos while on rides in a player's park, as well as a fishing excursion. Meanwhile, the expansion pass content's second of three acts will offer new rewards for upgrading the Royal Hourglass, in addition to new narrative content. But one big bonus is the A Day At Disney Star Path, a limited-time event that will introduce more Disney Parks content to the game, as well as the availability of more parks items from previous events arriving in the premium shop.

Everything Announced for the Disney Dreamlight Valley May 1 Update

  • Thrills and Frills free update
  • The Spark of Imagination expansion pass update
  • A Day At Disney Star Path
  • Daisy Duck and her Boutique
  • Oswald the Lucky Rabbit story content
  • More customization items and related weekly quests
  • Enhanced camera functions

Of course, two of the biggest new additions to the game will be the two new characters. Daisy comes free with the Thrills and Frills update, and she brings along her Boutique, which will allow players to show off their Touch of Magic designs and use other players' designs when visiting their Valleys. Players will also be able to unlock new Dreamlight Valley Touch of Magic items by completing weekly design challenges.

Oswald comes as part of the Dreamlight Valley expansion pass content. In addition to his quest line, Oswald, one of the earliest Disney characters, will be able to make a dynamic impact on the world, with abilities that range from turning critters from their normal full-color appearances to black-and-white versions of themselves, to transforming 2D objects into 3D objects.
